column4: I've downloaded the ubuntu windows setup program, and I'm really curious why they chose the bittorrent protocol to download the ISO. It seems illogical to me. Can anyone explain to me why they didn't just program the installer to use a random HTTP mirror!?
I suspect it's to distribute the bandwidth better. However, I would have problems with bittorrent as it is blocked here!
Exactly. My ISP caps my bandwidth, so I have to use encryption.
But, if there's HTTP mirrors available, why not use them!?
